result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas Eugene Landon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All court obligations shall be paid directly to Clerk of Court.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Nicholas Eugene Landon appeared by video, in custody from Lafayette County Jail.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Nicholas Eugene Landon.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Per agreement, defendant will plead to all counts. State will state defendant's record but remain silent as to a sentencing recommendation. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads no contest to charges. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. State states defendant's record and remains silent as to a sentencing recommendation. Attorney Richard heard. Defendant not heard. Court heard and orders: Ct 1- 1 year probation with a condition to pay costs, Cts 2-4: 4 years WSPS (2in and 2out)-STAYED and imposes 3 years probation with the following conditions: to participate in counseling that DOC deems appropriate, to submit to random observed drug testing, to maintain full time employment or seek work at a rate of 5 job applications per week, court costs waived, and to provide a DNA sample. Defendant is eligible for substance abuse but not challenges. If revoked, 27 days credit granted.

Defendant Nicholas Eugene Landon appeared by video, in custody from Grant County Jail.  Attorney Steven G. Richards not in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Richards does not appear due to schedule conflict. Prior to this hearing, Attorney Richards made Court aware of outcome of bond modification hearing with JVD from earlier today. Court heard and bond modification request denied. Status date remains.
Bail/bond hearing on September 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Nicholas Eugene Landon appeared by video, in custody from Grant County Jail.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Nicholas Eugene Landon.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Chad Chappell sworn and testified. Exhibit #1: Report- offered and received. Attorney Pozorski asks court to take judicial notice of Crawford Cty case 22CF77, Lafayette Cty case 21CF72, and Grant Cty case 22CF43. Court takes notice. Cross. Follow up. Attorney Richards heard. Attorney Pozorksi heard. Court binds matter over. Information filed. Attorney Richard heard on bond and requests a signature bond. Attorney Pozorski objects to a signature bond. Court heard and orders bond to remain as is. Defendant waives formal reading and pleads not guilty to charges. Status date set.
Status conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on November 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Nicholas Eugene Landon appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by phone for Nicholas Eugene Landon.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Richard has been appointed and is ready to proceed with a preliminary hearing. Preliminary hearing set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status conference on September 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Nicholas Eugene Landon appeared by video, in custody from Grant County Jail.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Charlotte Wynes appears in court. Court explains charges, penalties, and right to counsel. Defendant does qualify for SPD. Attorney Wynes will not be his attorney, making special appearance. State requests a $1000 cash bond. Attorney Wynes heard and requests a lower cash bond amount. Court heard and orders $3000 cash bond concurrent with his 4 pending cases in Grant County. Status date set.
